cheese 0.1.0

    • Building a descriptive analysis
  • Changelog

Bind a list of data frames back together

fasten.Rd

Roll up a list of arbitrary depth with data.frame's at the leaves row-wise.

fasten(
    list,
    into = NULL,
    depth = 0
)

Arguments

list

A list with data.frame's at the leaves.
into

A character vector of resulting column names. Defaults to NULL.
depth

Depth to bind the list to. Defaults to 0.

Details

Use empty strings "" in the into argument to omit column creation when rows are binded. Use positive integers for the depth to move from the root and negative integers to move from the leaves. The maximum (minimum) depth will be used for integers larger (smaller) than such. The leaves of the input list should be at the same depth.

Value

A tibble::tibble or reduced list

Examples

#Make a divided data frame
list <-
  heart_disease %>%
  divide(
    Sex,
    HeartDisease,
    ChestPain
  )

#Bind without creating names
list %>%
  fasten
#> # A tibble: 303 x 6
#>      Age    BP Cholesterol BloodSugar MaximumHR ExerciseInducedAngina
#>    <dbl> <dbl>       <dbl> <lgl>          <dbl> <fct>                
#>  1    58   150         283 TRUE             162 No                   
#>  2    66   150         226 FALSE            114 No                   
#>  3    69   140         239 FALSE            151 No                   
#>  4    60   150         240 FALSE            171 No                   
#>  5    41   130         204 FALSE            172 No                   
#>  6    56   140         294 FALSE            153 No                   
#>  7    71   160         302 FALSE            162 No                   
#>  8    41   105         198 FALSE            168 No                   
#>  9    45   130         234 FALSE            175 No                   
#> 10    55   135         250 FALSE            161 No                   
#> # … with 293 more rows

#Bind with names
list %>%
  fasten(
    into = c("Sex", "HeartDisease", "ChestPain")
  )
#> # A tibble: 303 x 9
#>    Sex   HeartDisease ChestPain   Age    BP Cholesterol BloodSugar MaximumHR
#>    <chr> <chr>        <chr>     <dbl> <dbl>       <dbl> <lgl>          <dbl>
#>  1 Fema… No           Typical …    58   150         283 TRUE             162
#>  2 Fema… No           Typical …    66   150         226 FALSE            114
#>  3 Fema… No           Typical …    69   140         239 FALSE            151
#>  4 Fema… No           Typical …    60   150         240 FALSE            171
#>  5 Fema… No           Atypical…    41   130         204 FALSE            172
#>  6 Fema… No           Atypical…    56   140         294 FALSE            153
#>  7 Fema… No           Atypical…    71   160         302 FALSE            162
#>  8 Fema… No           Atypical…    41   105         198 FALSE            168
#>  9 Fema… No           Atypical…    45   130         234 FALSE            175
#> 10 Fema… No           Atypical…    55   135         250 FALSE            161
#> # … with 293 more rows, and 1 more variable: ExerciseInducedAngina <fct>

#Only retain "Sex"
list %>%
  fasten(
    into = "Sex"
  )
#> # A tibble: 303 x 7
#>    Sex      Age    BP Cholesterol BloodSugar MaximumHR ExerciseInducedAngina
#>    <chr>  <dbl> <dbl>       <dbl> <lgl>          <dbl> <fct>                
#>  1 Female    58   150         283 TRUE             162 No                   
#>  2 Female    66   150         226 FALSE            114 No                   
#>  3 Female    69   140         239 FALSE            151 No                   
#>  4 Female    60   150         240 FALSE            171 No                   
#>  5 Female    41   130         204 FALSE            172 No                   
#>  6 Female    56   140         294 FALSE            153 No                   
#>  7 Female    71   160         302 FALSE            162 No                   
#>  8 Female    41   105         198 FALSE            168 No                   
#>  9 Female    45   130         234 FALSE            175 No                   
#> 10 Female    55   135         250 FALSE            161 No                   
#> # … with 293 more rows

#Only retain "HeartDisease"
list %>%
  fasten(
    into = c("", "HeartDisease")
  )
#> # A tibble: 303 x 7
#>    HeartDisease   Age    BP Cholesterol BloodSugar MaximumHR ExerciseInducedAng…
#>    <chr>        <dbl> <dbl>       <dbl> <lgl>          <dbl> <fct>              
#>  1 No              58   150         283 TRUE             162 No                 
#>  2 No              66   150         226 FALSE            114 No                 
#>  3 No              69   140         239 FALSE            151 No                 
#>  4 No              60   150         240 FALSE            171 No                 
#>  5 No              41   130         204 FALSE            172 No                 
#>  6 No              56   140         294 FALSE            153 No                 
#>  7 No              71   160         302 FALSE            162 No                 
#>  8 No              41   105         198 FALSE            168 No                 
#>  9 No              45   130         234 FALSE            175 No                 
#> 10 No              55   135         250 FALSE            161 No                 
#> # … with 293 more rows

#Bind up to Sex
list %>%
  fasten(
    into = c("HeartDisease", "ChestPain"),
    depth = 1
  )
#> $Female
#> # A tibble: 97 x 8
#>    HeartDisease ChestPain   Age    BP Cholesterol BloodSugar MaximumHR
#>    <chr>        <chr>     <dbl> <dbl>       <dbl> <lgl>          <dbl>
#>  1 No           Typical …    58   150         283 TRUE             162
#>  2 No           Typical …    66   150         226 FALSE            114
#>  3 No           Typical …    69   140         239 FALSE            151
#>  4 No           Typical …    60   150         240 FALSE            171
#>  5 No           Atypical…    41   130         204 FALSE            172
#>  6 No           Atypical…    56   140         294 FALSE            153
#>  7 No           Atypical…    71   160         302 FALSE            162
#>  8 No           Atypical…    41   105         198 FALSE            168
#>  9 No           Atypical…    45   130         234 FALSE            175
#> 10 No           Atypical…    55   135         250 FALSE            161
#> # … with 87 more rows, and 1 more variable: ExerciseInducedAngina <fct>
#> 
#> $Male
#> # A tibble: 206 x 8
#>    HeartDisease ChestPain   Age    BP Cholesterol BloodSugar MaximumHR
#>    <chr>        <chr>     <dbl> <dbl>       <dbl> <lgl>          <dbl>
#>  1 No           Typical …    63   145         233 TRUE             150
#>  2 No           Typical …    64   110         211 FALSE            144
#>  3 No           Typical …    40   140         199 FALSE            178
#>  4 No           Typical …    51   125         213 FALSE            125
#>  5 No           Typical …    34   118         182 FALSE            174
#>  6 No           Typical …    52   118         186 FALSE            190
#>  7 No           Typical …    52   152         298 TRUE             178
#>  8 No           Typical …    42   148         244 FALSE            178
#>  9 No           Typical …    59   178         270 FALSE            145
#> 10 No           Typical …    69   160         234 TRUE             131
#> # … with 196 more rows, and 1 more variable: ExerciseInducedAngina <fct>
#> 

#Same thing, but start at the leaves
list %>%
  fasten(
    into = c("HeartDisease", "ChestPain"),
    depth = -2
  )
#> $Female
#> # A tibble: 97 x 8
#>    HeartDisease ChestPain   Age    BP Cholesterol BloodSugar MaximumHR
#>    <chr>        <chr>     <dbl> <dbl>       <dbl> <lgl>          <dbl>
#>  1 No           Typical …    58   150         283 TRUE             162
#>  2 No           Typical …    66   150         226 FALSE            114

#>  6 No           Atypical…    56   140         294 FALSE            153

#> 10 No           Atypical…    55   135         250 FALSE            161

#Too large of depth returns original list
list %>%
  fasten(
    depth = 100
  )

  fasten(
    depth = -100
